properties.name: Billy Blank's World Training Center
properties.description: Posted by Christine 14708 Ventura Blvd. Sherman Oaks, CA 91403Tae-Bo studios -- it\'s more than just an infomercial. This is where I took a class with Billy Blanks AND where I received my first Jay-Walking ticket... 5

properties.name: Bootcamp MCRD San Diego
properties.description: Posted by Christine 1600 Henderson Ave, San Diego, CAThis is the 2nd week of bootcamp for my brother. His training will last 13 weeks, home for 10 days, then out for more training. After that he begins his 5 year commitment with the Military. I\'m over the shock and anger of him enlisting... now I\'m just sad and miss my brother. Be safe DJ.

properties.name: Costa Verde
properties.description: Posted by Christine 2nd night in Costa Rica -- this is where we\'ll be staying.

properties.name: Costa Verde
properties.description: Posted by Christine

properties.name: Costa Verde Hotel, Manuel Antonio
properties.description: Posted by Christine We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. It was the perfect place to relax during the first leg of our vacation. The only thing that separated us from the wild Rain Forest were screened in windows. Each night we woke up to the sound of the thunder and howler monkey\'s. It was great.

properties.name: Deception Pass State Park
properties.description: Posted by Christine  This park is one of my favorite places... I have visited this place since I was a kid. Today, it\'s where I choose to go when I meditate.

properties.name: Flying Elephants Deli
properties.description: Posted by ChristineThis is the overpriced-but-a-convenient-standby when I have forgotten to bring my lunch and need a bite during the day. Out of the 2 dozen or so chinese chicken salads I\'ve purchased there, ONLY 3 have had DIRT clumps in the spinach... But who\'s counting?

properties.name: Free Falling Dream (Woodland Park Zoo)
properties.description: Posted by Christine601 N 59th St, Seattle, 98103This dream was a reoccuring dream that took place when I was 4 - 6 years old. I was visiting Woodland park zoo and I stumbled upon a tricycle. I got on my new tricycle and continued to explore the zoo. I came upon a paved narrow walk-way that was 45 degrees steep. It was calling my name. I situated myself at the top of the walk-way and took-off. I quickly lost control of the tricycle and rolled off the edge. Tingling feet, screaming outloud... Right before I hit the ground... I woke up.

properties.name: General Jackson Showboat
properties.description: Posted by Christine mcgavock pike, nashville, tennesseeThis is the General Jackson Showboat - which floats up and down the Cumberland River in Nashville. I was on a business trip this week in Nashville and got the opportunity to visit the General Jackson. Biggest paddle boat I\'ve seen.

properties.name: Good eats
properties.description: Posted by Christine5714 SE Powell Blvd, Portland, OR, 97206I heard about this sushi restaurant from a co-worker. This place is actually only a few blocks from my house. Ichidai is tucked away inside a plain office complex. We\'ve driven by it for a year and a half -- never knowing the good eats that were right behind the rice paper screens. Ichidai offers delicious sushi, very fresh, and inexpensive. The pickled ginger was especially fresh. I\'ve read that the service is slow, but for us, the staff was plenty attentive.

properties.name: Grandma's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Christine 4515 SE 41st Ave, portland, oregon 97202Excellent breakfast - as well as an impressive collection of wooden wall carvings.

properties.name: Home Depot
properties.description: Posted by Christine10120 Se Washington St, Portland, ORHome Improvement Center

properties.name: Home of Abby & Amy
properties.description: Posted by ChristineAnn Marie Trail, Inver Grove Heights, MN 55077The home of my dearest friend Abby & the love of her life, Amy.

properties.name: Home of Howard Stern
properties.description: Posted by Christine1221 Avenue of the Americas, New York, New York 10020Place where Howard Stern now calls home. Aside from Howard Stern, satelite radio is worth the investment.

properties.name: Kauai Helicopter Ride
properties.description: Posted by Christine 3651 Ahukini Road, Lihue, HI 96766Place where Jake and I boarded for our amazing helicopter ride around the island of Kauai. The company was easy to deal with, our pilot was great, the views were amazing. Note: If you can get the front seat(s) if you can -- the people in the back were roasting because of the lack of a/c that hits them. Also, not to mention the views from the front...

properties.name: Kauai Vacation Rental House
properties.description: Posted by ChristineWhat a great vacation. Our house was settled among beautiful lush gardens, wild chickens and of course the Pacific Ocean. I can\'t wait to go back.

properties.name: LP Corp.
properties.description: Posted by Christine805 sw broadway, portland, or 97205

properties.name: LP Field (Home of Tennessee Titians)
properties.description: Posted by Christine S. 2nd street, nashville, tennesseeLP Field - The company I work for (LP Corp.) recently paid 30 million for a 10 year contract with the Tennessee Titians Field. I was on a bus ride to the General Jackson, and the local bus driver quoted "I don\'t much like the name, LP FIELD, but fer 30 million, I guess ya\'ll can it whatever you like".

properties.name: La Cascata - Princeville Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Christine This is where I spent my 30th birthday. La Cascata is a 5-star restaurant that overlooks Hanalei Bay and the Kauai sunset. Salads begin at 0 and main dishes run about 5 - 0... Which may include the elusive purple mashed potatoes Try the 3-Course special - for 5.

properties.name: Manuel Antonio Beach
properties.description: Posted by Christine  This beach is called one of the best/beautiful beaches in Costa Rica. It\'s calm waters make it very safe for children to swim.

properties.name: Most Laid Back Apartment Complex
properties.description: Posted by Christine Most Laid Back Apartment Complex A friend of mine lives at this apartment complex and if you live an alternative lifestyle and are looking for a place to call home -- try this complex. Here you can feel free to live life how you please without the fear of that one crazy uptight neighbor always saying, "please smoke out on the street!" Enjoy loud music? Turn it up! Are you looking for a place to let loose and celebrate life? Join the party next door!

properties.name: Near San Felipe
properties.description: Posted by Christine 3-week mission trip when i was 16. My youth group assisted in building an orphanage. The town we stayed in had no telephones, and no electricity. Quite an adventure.

properties.name: Nicholas' House
properties.description: Posted by Christine Nicholas\' base camp

properties.name: Official Band Busses Sign Holder
properties.description: Posted by Christine SW Salmon Street, Portland, OREgonI got the opportunity recently, for the 2nd year in a row, to be a part of the "Disband Crew" for the Portland Starlight Parade. This job is actually a 2-part job. The first part is guiding the 55 school busses. This place marks the exact spot where I stood - holding my sign proudly. The second part is disbanding the parade floats, bands, etc... Quite an exciting job. Something about that orange vest that commands authority!

properties.name: Opening scene of Gilligan's Island
properties.description: Posted by ChristineThis is a great beach... We visited here with my family. Jake and John were able to boogie board on one end while I and my parents snorkeled through the coral reefs on the other end. Definitely worth a visit.

properties.name: Paley's Place
properties.description: Posted by Christine  1204 nw 21st 97209"Best Place to Kiss".... According to City Search.

properties.name: Paradox Palace Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Christine   3439 SE Belmont portland, orDelicious eats... I love their vegan french toast!

properties.name: Pastini Pastaria
properties.description: Posted by Christine 2027 SE Division, Portland, OR 97202Good inexpensive Italian favorites.

properties.name: Pioneer Courthouse square
properties.description: Posted by Christine  Most likely place to be pan-handled, asked to sign the latest petition, or asked to sponsor a child in Africa. Also a great place to catch free concerts in the summer time - high tunes at noon.

properties.name: Presents of Mind
properties.description: Posted by Christine  3633 SE HAWTHORNE BLVD, PORTLAND, OR 97214Great selection of cards and other great random gifts - from diaper bags to cat-butt magnets.

properties.name: Rocket Dream
properties.description: Posted by Christine112 N Cherry St, burlington, wa, 98233This was a re-occurring dream that hung around for a number of years... Around the time when I was a child, between years 4 - 7. It began with me walking into Bellow\'s Tavern looking for someone. I\'d walk up to the bar and the bartender would motion to the bar stool. I\'d take a seat. She then pushes a bowl full of peanuts or rather peanut shells towards me. I am asked to look for a peanut that has not yet been shelled. I begin to digg for the peanut - instantly I find myself neck deep in a room full of peanut shells... No peanuts in site. When I return to the bar, and explain to the bartender I could find none -- she points to a rocket that is sitting behind the bar. This rocket is positioned at a 45 degree angle with a foot long fuse at the end of it. She say\'s to me, "you know what to do". At this point, I know what I have to do... Feeling once again defeated by the elusive peanut, I sit on top of the rocket (cartoon style). She lights the fuse, and.... I wake up.

properties.name: Salon NYLA
properties.description: Posted by Christine 327 SW PINE STREET, Portland Oregon, 97204In my unending quest to find the "perfect" stylist... I\'ve landed here. It\'s a delightful, non-pretentious, friendly salon. Many times, while getting my hair done, I\'m offered a hand massage for no charge. A little slice of heaven. Prices are average for a downtown salon. Ann & Yuki are my favorite stylists...

properties.name: Scatter Creek Rest Area Northbound (MP 90)
properties.description: Posted by ChristineThis is a good hour and a half into my trip to see my family. This rest area has nice wide open fields -- great for dogs. They offer coffee and cookies for a small donation. The bathrooms are clean and well lit.

properties.name: Sea Tac Rest Area Northbound (MP 140)
properties.description: Posted by ChristineThere is something about the convenience of Rest Areas... If you\'re in the car with me, heading up to visit my parents, and you have to pee, you\'ll more than likely have to wait for a rest area to appear. I find getting off the freeway to find a place to relieve myself is a serious waste of time. This is a "bare-bones" rest stop, but hits my list because it\'s clean. It also hits my list because it\'s the last rest area for 67 miles.

properties.name: Shortest Green Light in PDX
properties.description: Posted by ChristineShortest Green Light in PDXIntersection @ SE Ladd Ave & SE Division. This green light allows for an average of 2 cars per green light. Annoying...

properties.name: Silver Lake Rest Area Southbound (MP 188)
properties.description: Posted by ChristineThis rest area is Southbound. It\'s only about 45 down I-5 from my folks house - so you\'d think it\'s a little too soon to stop for a break... but since this is the last rest area for 95 MILES (poor planning WSDOT) - I usually end up stopping here as a precaution. God forbid I have to stop somewhere in Seattle to find a restroom! Another bonus to this one is that there is a small Police Station right there... So it\'s also SAFE!

properties.name: Stanich's
properties.description: Posted by Christine  4915 NE Fremont St, Portland, OR 97213The place where Jake and I end up taking our meat-eating out-of-town guests. Delicious and cheap burgers! Excellent display of sports banners from the early 70\'s thru the 80\'s.

properties.name: The Amazing Gift race -- Clue #1 (Baja Fresh)
properties.description: Posted by Christine  1505 NE 40TH Ave Portland, OR 97232I opened my first clue expecting to see a gift certificate of some sorts... what I found was a riddle: "Say to the front desk "Hi, I\'m Christine" At the Journey on Kearney Recovery is pristine I looked at Jake -- waiting for the punchline... I remember laughing and asking him over and over -- "What is this?!?!" All he said was, you\'ve got to go. If you get stuck, there is a number on the back of your envelope... Call it for help. I turn the envelope over and it says "Phone a friend - 503-***-****". I was so nervous - I had no idea what this was -- and WHO\'S number was this?! Jake gave me a kiss -- and then he was gone. Leaving me in Baja Fresh\'s parking lot. So, I got in my car and headed to Northwest Portland where I was sure I was making my way towards a spa called Journey on Kearney... Half way to NW, I decided to phone my friend and see if I could figure out if I was heading in the right direction. I nervously dialed the number -- half way realizing who it was (Jake\'s parents). Jake\'s Dad answers the phone and says "Hello, this is phone a friend." I said "Lance?!"... "I need help figuring out where I\'m supposed to go." He gave me a few more clues which confirmed I was heading the correct direction. So I continued on...

properties.name: The Amazing Gift race -- Clue #2 (Alano Club)
properties.description: Posted by Christine909 NW 24th Ave, Portland, OR 97210So, I arrived at my destination - and it was not a spa, however as do some spa\'s -- this place is the home of relaxation and healing. I found myself at the Alano Club. A large house in the heart of NW Portland which is the home of many recovery meetings. I walked inside and found a front desk. There was a woman behind the desk and I said "Hi, my name is Christine". While I was expecting her to say "That\'s nice, can I help you?"... She just smiled and handed me another yellow envelope. I thanked her for the envelope and hurried outside to open my 2nd clue. It said: Method air on a dare How high can you ollie? This jungle of plywood Is the Department of Folly I thought -- What?! Wait, ok, I know this one... This one is easier. It\'s the Department of Skateboarding! Ha, I was getting better at these riddles! See, Jake is a skateboarder and he\'s spent many hours of his life at the Department. I as his girlfriend have been there a few times myself. So, I\'m off... As I\'m driving over to DOS, I begin to wonder what is happening? What is going on? How long will this continue? I actually thought that Jake would be waiting for me at the Department with a Christmas gift... The following week was christmas and Jake and I would be spending it apart. Me with my family in Washington and he, in PDX. So, I thought it was very logical that he\'d be waiting with my Christmas gifts at the Department... On the drive over to DOS, I also distinctively recall telling myself to "stay in the moment"... See, I am very good at projecting the future -- and being completely wrong! For a moment I thought -- what if??? But, in order to not get my hopes up, I pushed out all ideas of what was at the end of this journey and just played along.

properties.name: The Amazing Gift race -- Clue #3 (Department of Skateboarding)
properties.description: Posted by Christine  15 NE Hancock St, Portland, OR 97212I arrived at the Department feeling a bit shy as I am not a skateboarder, nor have I been there without Jake. Being there alone seemed out of place. However, pushing my insecurities aside, I walked inside and was greeted with smiles. I knew Jason, who was working -- and said "Ummm, do you have a clue for me?" He smiled and gladly handed over another yellow envelope. I opened it and it read: Skateboards and drugs Only one peaks my interest Buy the CCCP sticker That they say is the "pimpest" With my new found confidence in solving riddles, this one again, took little effort. "CCCP" was the give away, Corporate Coercion Cals Pharmacy... aka Cal\'s Pharmacy. Another place where Jake and I have frequented... (which is actually no longer. It is now ajoined with DOS.) The guys wished me "good luck"... And once again, I was off...

properties.name: The Amazing Gift race -- Clue #4 (Cal's Pharmacy)
properties.description: Posted by Christine  1636 E. Burnside Portland, OR 97214I walk into Cal\'s Pharmacy and once again, am greeted by a number of faces -- many of which are displaying smiles which indicate, they may know something more than I do... Strange feeling. I go up to Bird -- and let him know that I need to purchase the "pimpest" sticker they have. He leads me to a CCCP sticker in the glass case and say\'s -- "this is it". He give\'s me the sticker and I pay him .50 cents. He also hands me a clue. It read: Bulgogi and kimchee Books raining from Heaven Find homer\'s Odyssey Turn to page 57 Hummmm.... Ok, at this point, my nerves are shot. My voice is a bit quivery and I\'ve got a knot in my stomach. Forget trying to play it cool in front of the guys at Cal\'s -- I\'m FREAKING out here! I\'m laughing nervously and trying to focus. Finally, I realize -- I must be heading to Jake\'s parents house. Why? "Bulgogi and kimchee" Jake\'s mother is Korean and these are two items that are made and consumed in their house frequently. Also, "Books raining from Heaven". To say Jake\'s Dad is an avid reader is an understatement. This house is where Powell books goes to stock up on inventory. :) So, I head east.

properties.name: The Amazing Gift race -- Clue #5 (Jake's Parent's house)
properties.description: Posted by Christine  I arrive at Jake\'s parents house, and sense a feeling of finallity about this whole thing. However, when they open the door to greet me -- I see no Jake. So, I ask them if they can guide me to Homers Odyssey (without help I could have searched all day) -- I found the book and turned to Page 57. Here was my clue: A geek you\'re in love with A true gadget hacker Go to his website And enter the password WEBSITE? PASSWORD? What\'s happening!?!? God, I was so excited and nervous... Jake\'s parents guide me to their computer and I say -- What password? I don\'t have a password! They asked me to look at the last clue I had received... I looked at my clue -- Nothing. I then retrieved the "pimpest" sticker I had purchased... Sure enough -- on the back it said: User: comesit Password: righthere (Inside joke) So type this in and am lead to my last and final clue.

properties.name: The Amazing Gift race -- Clue #6 (Volcano @ Mt. Tabor)
properties.description: Posted by Christine  The final clue on his website read: The AMAZING GIFT To reward your hard labor Waits at the Volcano Also known as Mt. Tabor Jake\'s parents wished me well and I was off. Leaving Jake\'s parent\'s house, I tried to focus and remember how to get to Mount Tabor -- A route I\'ve traveled many times before, however, at this point, I felt as though I was in a foreign city. Was it really happening? Am I going to be able to find in at the Park? I was so happy that I was going to find him -- all of this anticipation will finally be over... I park my car and peak my head over the ledge, overlooking the amphitheater to see if he\'s there. He was. He said, "Get down here!" I ran to him an noticed him standing next to a gift wrapped in Christmas paper. The box was about 8" x 8". He instructed me to open it. What was inside was a GIGANTIC ring.... About 4" x 3" in size. When I saw the ring, I finally knew what this was. At that moment, Jake got down on one knee, and revealed another ring -- one that would fit my finger. He asked me to marry him. Through my tears, I said yes.

properties.name: Trezise Family Homestead
properties.description: Posted by Christine  1920 Traditional Tudor that the Trezise family has lived in since 1988

properties.name: Trumpeter Swans Sighting
properties.description: Posted by ChristineWent home for thanksgiving last weekend up to Skagit Valley. My Dad insisted on us stopping and checking out the trumpeter swan\'s, who migrate to the Valley for the winter from the Antarctica. About 2/3rd\'s through our walk, we came upon hundreds of these birds hanging out in a water-logged field. I never realized how big these birds are -- their wing span is about 7 feet long and their body length is 3 - 4 feet long. Beautiful birds.

properties.name: United General Hospital
properties.description: Posted by Christine my birthplace - a small hick-town full of ten-gallon hats, pick-up trucks and gun-racks

properties.name: Where I was on 9/11
properties.description: Posted by Christine1413 ne hancock, portland, oregonI was at home getting ready for work. Listening to Howard Stern, interupt the west-coast playback - for a live report from NY. Listened to Stern reporting the events, watching the news... not knowing what to do. Go to work? I went to work and I remember sittin on the bus -- the bus was silent. Everyone seemed glued to their headphones listening to the latest developments.

properties.name: Wine Country Farm - Sara & Jorgen's Wedding location
properties.description: Posted by Christine dayton, oregonThis lovely vineyard is known more for it\'s wonderful bed & breakfast over the actual wine (so I\'ve been told). Sara & Jorgen\'s wedding was held here on Saturday, July 22nd. It was a beautiful ceremony in a breathtaking setting. During the ceremony, I glanced up and noticed hawks soaring above our heads... It was magical. After the wedding, the reception was in full swing with delicious eats and great music by the Freak Mountain Ramblers (http://www.freakmountain.com). It was a wonderful wedding and a great celebration of life.

properties.name: my house
properties.description: Posted by Jake 3100 se 53rd ave, portland, or
